meanings.sent1: She had to use both limbi to carry the heavy boxes.
meanings.sent2: The limbi of the octopus help it move gracefully underwater.
meanings.sent3: The limbi of the spider danced in the air as it spun its web.
meanings.sent4: The limbi of the tree reached out like welcoming arms.
meanings.sent5: The limbi of the robot moved with precision and grace.

meanings.definition: A branch or division of a tree or plant.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree had many limbi filled with ripe fruit.
meanings.sent2: The limbi of the oak tree provided shade on hot days.
meanings.sent3: The limbi of the bush rustled in the wind like a secret whisper.
meanings.sent4: The limbi of the vine reached out to climb the garden wall.
meanings.sent5: The limbi of the palm tree swayed in the tropical breeze.
